rationale: Cards with onClick handlers look and behave like buttons for mouse users (cursor: pointer, hover effects) but are invisible to keyboard navigation. This violates WCAG 2.1 Level A (2.1.1 Keyboard, 4.1.2 Name/Role/Value). The DashboardPage, ProjectsPage, and Analytics pages heavily use KPICard and ProjectCard with click handlers, making major workflows keyboard-inaccessible.
problemSolved: Card.tsx line 60-72: StyledCard renders with onClick={onClick} but no role, tabIndex, onKeyDown, or aria-label. The StyledCard (lines 22-41) sets cursor:'pointer' when hoverable=true, indicating interactive intent, but provides no keyboard affordances. KPICard (line 156), FeatureCard (line 255), and ProjectCard (line 330) all pass onClick to the base Card without accessibility props. TestimonialsCarousel dot indicators (styled Box elements with onClick) also lack keyboard support.
